instruction: You should find a few LATEX templates appropriate for the task at hand and list the links to them. Homework Assignment
output:
One popular LaTeX template that can be used for writing academic papers is "IEEEtran" which follows IEEE formatting guidelines. It's widely used in computer science, engineering, mathematics and related fields. Here's an example of its usage: https://www.overleaf.com/latex/templates/template-for-ieee-conference-proceedings-with-latex/sibkxjydbtnd

Another commonly-used template is "article", which provides basic structure suitable for many types of documents including research articles or technical reports. You could use it as such: \documentclass{article}

There are also more specific templates designed specifically for certain kinds of publications like journals or conference proceedings - these usually follow different style guides with their own set of requirements on layout and content organization. For instance, if you're submitting your work to ACM conferences, they have a dedicated template available here: http://www.acm.org/publications/authors/submissions/format-and-template-information/

In general, when choosing a LaTeX template, make sure it suits your needs in terms of format, structure and overall appearance.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.instructional purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.a

instruction:
Write a simple guide for uploading the bibliography database
 on Overleaf.
output:
Uploading your Bibliography Database to Overleaf is easy and straightforward. Here are the steps you need to follow:

1. Create or open a project in Overleaf: First, create a new project by clicking on "New Project" from the left sidebar menu, then select the document type (e.g., LaTeX) that you want to use. Alternatively, if you already have an existing project, click on it to access its dashboard.

2. Access BibTeX tab: Click on the "BibTeX" tab at the top of the editor window. This will take you to the section where all your references should be added.

3. Upload file: Click on the "Upload File(s)" button located next to the "Add New Entry." Once clicked, this will pop up a dialog box allowing you to choose the file containing your bibliography data. You can also add multiple files separated with commas.

4. Select file location: After selecting the desired file, navigate to the folder where the uploaded bib-file resides using the navigation bar below the text editor area. If necessary, move back into the main directory so that the.bib file appears within the list of available files.

5. Add entries: Finally, select the newly-uploaded.bib file and click “OK”. The program automatically adds each entry listed in the selected file as a separate line item under the "References” heading. 

6. Compile & Preview: Now compile your project using the "Quick Build" icon, which checks whether any errors exist in the code before displaying the output. In case there are no issues, preview the changes made to see how the citations appear in-text.


That’s it! Your bibliography database has now been successfully uploaded onto Overleaf. From hereon out, whenever you update your bibliographic information, simply repeat these six steps again.al texts.al texts.al texts.instructional texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts.al texts

instruction:
How would you describe the meaning of this lyrics? Describe some of the metaphors. My lover’s got humor
She’s the giggle at a funeral
Knows everybody’s disapproval
I should’ve worshipped her sooner
output:
This lyric is from "Lover" by Taylor Swift, and it describes how she feels about her romantic partner. The first line refers to their shared sense of playfulness and joy in each other's company. 

The metaphor of being 'the giggles at a funeral' suggests that even when things are sad or difficult, they have an ability to find lightness and laughter together. This shows the strength of their relationship and bond as well as its enduring nature - no matter what life throws at them, they can still laugh and enjoy one another's presence.

The third line mentions the fact that others may not approve of their love for various reasons; perhaps because of social differences, age gap or background but they don't let these opinions get in the way of their happiness with each other. It implies self-assurance and confidence in their choice to be together.

Overall, the lines convey a message of deep affection, intimacy, and closeness between two people who share a special connection despite any outside criticism or challenges.al writing.al writing.al writing.instructional writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing.al writing

instruction: Make a list of the most popular podcasts.
output:
1. "This American Life" - NPR's flagship podcast, hosted by Ira Glass and featuring true stories told in an engaging manner.
2. "My Favorite Murder" - A comedy/crime podcast where hosts Karen Kilgariff and Georgia Hardstark discuss their favorite murder cases.
3. "Serial" - This investigative journalism show is produced by Sarah Koenig and tells one long-form story each season.
4. "The Joe Rogan Experience"- Hosted by comedian Joe Rogan, this podcast features discussions on various topics including sports, politics, science, and pop culture with famous guests from all walks of life.
5. "Pod Save America" - Four former Obama staffers host this political commentary program that discusses current events and interviews politicians, journalists, activists, and celebrities.
6. "Radiolab" - Produced by WNYC Studios, Radiolab delves into scientific discoveries, cultural developments, and human behavior through storytelling and compelling audio production.
7. "WTF With Marc Maron" - Comedian Marc Maron conducts unscripted conversations with actors, musicians, comedians, and other public figures about their lives and careers.
8. "Up First" - The morning news summary podcast from NPR, presented by Steve Inskeep, Rachel Martin, and David Greene.
9. "Crime Junkie" - Ashley Flowers and Brit Prawat host this weekly podcast which covers different criminal investigations, trials, and court proceedings.

instruction:
You should take the time to read the situation and problem carefully and give the best advice you can. I'm roadtripping down New Zealand with a friend and he is driving me insane. He hasn't enjoyed all the tours we've been on and doesn't want to chat about ANYTHING. We're a week into our trip and this is the quietest I've ever been when hanging out with another person as he rebuffs all my attempts at conversation. He wears his airpods in the car and around the accommodation - not that I've kept trying to talk to him. Honestly, he is bringing some seriously bad vibes to everything and it's ruining my trip.
We don't have anything booked in yet for the South Island, so I'm planning to ditch him in Wellington at the ferry. Probably book my own car in Picton and just relax alone for the rest of the trip. (Just thinking about it is such sharp relief that it makes me feel emotional. I'll pay whatever price I have to just to get away from him.)
Obviously telling him he is ruining my trip with his negative energy isn't the best way to approach this.
Any advice for the best approach so we can split amicably? Or at least not have an argument that ends with very hurt feelings?
output: It seems like your traveling companion has different interests than yours which are causing tension between both of you. It would be better if you could sit together and communicate openly about what each other wants to do during the trip. You might suggest sharing responsibilities while making plans or even dividing the itinerary according to individual preferences. If communication fails, then perhaps it will be more beneficial for both of you to go separate ways instead of continuously being unhappy. However, try talking to them first before taking any drastic measures.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.instructional guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance.al guidance

instruction: You are given a description that provides a set of facts or a scenario. It is up to you to craft a story from these facts and scenarios. The missing pieces must be filled in with imaginative but logical information. Ten European football teams – the Netherlands, England, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland and Wales – will participate in a season-long “OneLove” campaign promoting inclusion and opposing discrimination.
output:
The stadium was packed full of cheering fans waving their flags as ten European football teams took the field for what would become an epic event. These were no ordinary matches; this tournament marked something bigger than just sports - it represented unity among nations who had been divided by history, culture and politics. 

At the center of all this excitement stood the "One Love" campaign which aimed at bringing together people from different backgrounds through the love for one game- Football! This initiative brought together countries like the Netherlands, England, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland, and Wales under one banner, representing diversity and inclusivity on and off the pitch.

As each team stepped onto the field, they did so not only wearing their national colors but also holding hands with players from other participating countries, showing solidarity towards the cause. Fans cheered loudly and waved banners emblazoned with messages such as 'No racism' and 'All equal'. Every time there was a goal scored, instead of celebrating individually, players from both sides joined hands, forming human chains across the pitch, displaying the true spirit of camaraderie.

This tournament became more than just about winning games, scoring goals, and collecting trophies. It symbolized peace between warring factions and hope amidst despair. As the days passed, it seemed as though every match played out was another victory against hatred, bigotry, and prejudice. With each passing day, the One Love Campaign grew stronger, spreading its message far and wide.al.al.al.instructional.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al

instruction: Please suggest a few papers to consider based on the search term given. The names of the papers should be listed. Topic: scaling law + machine learning
output:
1) "Scaling laws for neural population codes," by M. Latham and H. Gishler, published in Neural Computation (2005). This paper investigates how well neural populations scale with varying stimulus parameters.
 
2) "A Scaling Law For the Training Time of Deep Linear Neural Networks,” by S. Liang et al., published in Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (2019), which presents an analysis of deep linear networks' training time as they increase in size.

3) “The scaling problem in big data analytics: A survey”, by J. Wang et.al, published in IEEE Transactions on Big Data (2020). It focuses on discussing the challenges associated with handling large datasets using traditional statistical methods and proposes solutions to overcome them. 

4) "On the importance of scale for transfer learning", by B. Kérel et al., published in Machine Learning Journal (2018). This study discusses the effect that different scales have when transferring learned features from one task to another.al algorithms for deep reinforcement learning, published in Nature Neuroscience(2016).

5) “Machine Learning Scalability Through Distributed Inference”, by D. Sculley et al., published at ICML Workshop on Large-Scale Kernel Methods (2010). This research examines distributed inference strategies for increasing scalability while maintaining accuracy in machine learning tasks.al algorithms for deep reinforcement learning, published in Nature Neuroscience(2016).

instruction:
A job description is a document that clearly states the requirements, duties, responsibilities, and skills required to perform a specific role. You need to write a job description based on the given information. You should describe responsibilities and duties in your job description in a logical order. Remember that potential employees often get their first impression of your company from your job description. So, the job description should convey the attractiveness of your company. Company: [Company name]
Job: Software Engineer
Job Responsibilities:
Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers.
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest.
Work collaboratively with fellow software engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders.
Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects.
Skills and experience that will lead to success:
Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.
Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Experience writing SQL queries 
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Eagerness to work in a highly-collaborative environment
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful
output:
Software Engineer Job Description:

[Company Name] is seeking an experienced Software Engineer for our dynamic team. This individual must have strong technical abilities combined with excellent interpersonal skills to help us continue delivering innovative solutions to our customers. The ideal candidate would be passionate about developing quality products while working effectively within a collaborative team.

Responsibilities:
- Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers
- Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest
- Work collaboratively with fellow software engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders
- Participate in agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark
- Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects 

Requirements:
- Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.
- Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
- Experience writing SQL queries
- Strong written and verbal communication skills
- Eagerness to work in a highly-collaborative environment
-Some visualization experience such as Tableau or Power BI is helpful.

Thank you very much for your interest and application to our company. We appreciate the time that it took to submit an impressive resume and cover letter along with all of your qualifications. instruction:
Write a section for a blog post and try to cover all of the provided information about this section in your text. Blog Topic: 7 Fall Fashion Trends Worth Taking on Your Trip
Section Title: Trusty Jeans
Main point of the section: jeans can be worn all year and look good with everything .
output:
As we transition from summer into fall, it's time to start thinking about updating our wardrobes. One item that is always fashionable no matter what season or style you're going for are trusty jeans! This versatile piece can take any outfit up a notch while keeping things casual and comfortable. Here are some reasons why you should incorporate more denim pieces into your wardrobe as we head into colder months:

1) Versatility- Jeans go well with almost anything. You could wear them dressed down with sneakers and a tee shirt or dress them up with heels and an elegant blouse. There’s really not much you can’t do with these timeless trousers!

2) Comfort - Nothing beats wearing something super comfy when temperatures drop outside. Denim pants keep you warm without sacrificing comfort.

3) Timeless Style – When done right, nothing says classic cool like blue jeans. They never seem to go out of fashion which makes investing in a pair worth every penny.

4) Layering Friendly - Wearing layers during autumn is key but finding clothing items that allow easy layering isn't always easy. With jeans being such a simple bottom choice, they make adding extra garments over top effortless.

5) Affordable - Investing in high-quality denim doesn't have to break the bank. Whether shopping at affordable stores or designer ones, there’s bound to be a price range everyone will appreciate.

There’s just so many great reasons why jeans remain one of the most popular clothing choices even after years since their invention. So next time you’re looking for new clothes to add to your collection, don’t forget about picking yourself up a fresh pair of denims.al.al.al.al.al.al.instructional.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al

instruction: Discuss the origins and history of the word that has been given to you. oblique
output:
The English term "oblique" is derived from Latin, where it originated as 'oblīquus', which means slanting or sloping. The word was first used in Middle English around the year 1300, meaning something crooked or not straight. It came into use with its current definition - describing a line at an angle other than perpendicular - by the mid-14th century.

In medieval times, obliquity referred specifically to anything curved, twisted, or bent, while later on, during the Renaissance period, the term gained more technical meanings such as relating to angles or lines that are neither horizontal nor vertical. In the early modern era, the term evolved further when people began using it to describe speech, writing or actions that were indirect, circuitous or roundabout instead of straightforward or direct.

Over time, the usage of the word expanded beyond geometry to encompass many fields including literature, philosophy, music, sports and even fashion design. Today, it retains all these various definitions but remains most commonly associated with non-perpendicular alignment or direction, especially within mathematical contexts..instructio

instruction: Write a step-by-step guide for resolving GitHub merge conflicts.
output:
Here is the step by step process to resolve GitHub merge conflicts:

1. Identify the conflicting files: The first thing you need to do after merging two branches, which results in conflicts on your repository, is identify all those files that are showing conflict markers like `<<<<<<<` and `>>>>>>>`.

2. Open the conflicted file: Click on each of these files one by one, open them up, and see what changes have been made by both sides.

3. Reviewing Changes: Once you've opened the file, review the changes carefully. You can compare the code between different versions easily using Git diff commands or visual tools integrated with Github.

4. Selecting a version: After reviewing the changes, choose whether you want to keep the change from either side (your local copy or remote branch) or discard it entirely. Most times, the best approach would be to pick the latest version of the content as long as they're not breaking anything critical.

5. Resolving Conflicts Manually: If required, manually edit the conflicting sections within the text editor itself so that everything looks good once again. Make sure to save the file when done.

6. Staging Conflict Resolution: Add the resolved file to staging area using git add command.

7. Committing the resolution: Finally commit the resolution of the conflict along with any other relevant message describing the work performed.

8. Pushing the merged changes: Lastly push the resolved conflicts back into the remote repository.

By following this simple set of steps, you should now successfully resolve any type of merge conflicts arising while merging two separate branches together on GitHub.al.instructional.al.al.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.alal.ala

instruction:
One or more jobs can be run automatically by a workflow. The workflows are defined in the repository as YAML files and will run if an event occurs in the repository, as well as manually, or on a certain schedule.
Bring an example of a workflow that demonstrate the CI/CD features of GitHub Actions.
output:
A simple workflow for running multiple jobs could look like this:

```yaml
name: Continuous Integration

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - master # Run whenever someone pushes to the'master' branch

jobs:
  build_and_test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2 
        with:
          path:./
      - name: Build
        run: make build
      - name: Test
        run: make test
  
  deploy_to_production:
    needs: [build_and_test]
    runs-on: windows-2019
    environment:
       name: Production
       url: https://my-production-server.com      
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2  
      - name: Deploy
        env:
            DEPLOY_KEY: ${{ secrets.DEPLOY_KEY }}
        run: rsync -avz./dist/* remote-user@$ {environment.url}:path/to/deploy/folder
```

In this workflow we have two separate job definitions `build_and_test` which is responsible for building our codebase and testing it using unit tests while another one named `deploy_to_production`, which deploys our built application into production after all tests pass successfully. 

The first step defines when the workflow should trigger (in this case every time there's a new commit pushed to the main/master branch). Next comes the actual definition of each individual job where we define what kind of machine they're going to execute on (`ubuntu-latest` or `windows-2019`) along with any required setup commands/steps needed before actually executing them(`uses: action/checkout`). Each job has its own set of steps, so here you'll see tasks such as checking out source code from Git repository, making sure dependencies are installed, compiling sources, and finally running automated tests.

After both jobs complete execution, we use the keyword `needs:` to ensure that the deployment job only executes once the previous build & test phase completes without errors. We also specify the target operating system for deploying the app onto, Windows Server 2019 in this scenario, along with some environmental variables necessary for authentication purposes during file transfer operations..instructio

Review 1: I'm not sure if it's just the fact that Ed Norton really grates on me in this film, but I never really bought into the idea of Fight Club being some kind of cultural phenomenon. Yes it's an innovative story, told via a strong script, engaging characters and intense cinematography. But is it really worthy of such high praise? Personally, I find it starts to fall apart halfway through and actually becomes quite tedious towards the end. Everything just becomes a little bit childish and contrived as the story loses touch with its base elements and the rage against the machine vibe takes over. Review 3: Despite a good theme, great acting and important messages that this movie convey in an unorthodox way, I think it fails to connect the audience with the storyline and leaves him in a world of confusion. Although, majority of reviews find this movie entertaining and interesting, yet I would choose to be a minority that believes that this movie is extremely overrated.
Review 4: Is creating chaos, explosions and membership in a militant sect the way to get rid of material shackles ?! The visual effects are fascinating and the story is compelling until the second half. Unfortunately, it doesn't end well.

instruction: Write a short analysis of the cinematography in the movie. Dead Poets Society
output:
The cinematography in Dead Poet's Society is quite remarkable, with many scenes being shot and framed beautifully. The film uses a lot of close-ups to emphasize emotions and reactions of characters as they navigate their experiences at Welton Academy. One particularly striking example would be when Neil Perry (Robert Sean Leonard) first sees his father after breaking down during an assembly performance. In this scene, the camera zooms in on both faces simultaneously, emphasizing the tension between them through visual composition alone.

Another notable aspect of the cinematography is how it captures the vibrancy of youth and the energy of young people discovering themselves for the first time. Many shots are fast-paced or hand-held, giving viewers a sense of movement that mirrors the chaotic yet exhilarating experience of growing up. For instance, one memorable sequence involves the boys running around campus, climbing over walls and fences while the camera follows them closely, capturing the thrill of rebellion and adventure.

Overall, the cinematography in Dead Poets Society effectively conveys the mood, tone, and themes of the story. Through its use of lighting, framing, angles, and movements, it successfully transports us into the world of these students and allows us to feel what they're going through.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.instructional purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purposes only.al purpose

instruction: Please let me know your thoughts on the given place and why you think it deserves to be visited. Barcelona, Spain
output: Barcelona is a city that I would highly recommend visiting. It has something for everyone - from stunning architecture such as Gaudi's La Sagrada Familia or Park Guell, to beautiful beaches like Barceloneta Beach, bustling markets selling delicious local cuisine, world-renowned museums (such as Picasso Museum), and vibrant nightlife in areas like El Raval and Gothic Quarter. There are also many historical landmarks and monuments such as Barcelona Cathedral and Montjuic Castle which tell stories of its rich history. The city itself is very walkable with plenty of public transportation options if needed. Overall, there’s no shortage of things to see and do while exploring this captivating Spanish city!

instruction: Consider the best time of year to visit the given city, and provide your reasons for choosing that time. Sydney, Australia
output: The best time to visit Sydney is during its spring season (September-November) or in autumn (March-May). During these seasons, temperatures are mild and comfortable with fewer crowds. Spring also marks the beginning of the Australian summer events calendar, including festivals such as Vivid Sydney, which lights up the harbor city each June with stunning light installations and music performances. Autumn brings more affordable prices on accommodations and flights while still enjoying pleasant weather conditions.

instruction: Name the top cities in France that should not be missed. Include the best aspects of each place as well.
output:
Some of the must-see cities in France are Paris, Lyon, Marseille, Nice, Toulouse and Bordeaux. Each city has its unique charm, rich history, beautiful architecture, world-class museums, delicious food, and lively culture which makes it a worth-visiting destination.
Paris is often referred to as "the City of Love" because of its romantic atmosphere, stunning landmarks such as Eiffel Tower, Louvre Museum, Notre-Dame Cathedral, etc., and picturesque streets lined with charming cafes and bistros.
Lyon is known for being one of the gastronomic capitals of the world due to its exceptional cuisine and numerous Michelin-starred restaurants. It's also famous for its medieval and Renaissance-era architecture, especially Vieux Lyon (Old Town), where you can find many historic buildings and monuments.
Marseille is a vibrant port city located on the Mediterranean Sea, renowned for its bustling markets, diverse cultural heritage, and seaside promenades. The Old Port area is particularly interesting, with its mix of ancient ruins, modern architecture, and street-side cafés.
Nice is an elegant coastal town situated along the French Riviera. Known for its sunny weather, pristine beaches, palm-lined boulevards, and art deco buildings, this city attracts visitors all year round. It’s home to several notable museums like Musée Chagall and Musée Matisse, dedicated to some of the most iconic artists from the Fauvism movement.
Toulouse is nicknamed “La Ville Rose” or Pink City because of its distinct pink-colored brick buildings. This university town boasts excellent examples of Gothic architecture, including Saint-Sernin Basilica – Europe’s largest surviving Romanesque building. Its culinary scene revolves around regional specialties like cassoulet, a hearty bean stew made with duck confit and sausage.
Bordeaux is considered by many to be the wine capital of France. With more than 3000 chateaus producing wines, there’s no shortage of opportunities to sample fine vintages here. Besides wineries, the city offers plenty of other attractions too, including grandiose 18th-century architecture, lovely parks, and outstanding museums like Musée des Beaux-Arts de Bordeaux, showcasing works by Rembrandt, Rubens, Poussin, and others.al text.al text.al text.instructional text.al text.al text.al text.al text.al text.al text.al text.al text.a

instruction: Design a programming problem related to the subject that has been given to you. Use some examples and constraints to improve your question. Dynamic Programming

Provide a Java solution to the following problem. Given an integer n, return true if it is a power of three. Otherwise, return false.
An integer n is a power of three, if there exists an integer x such that n == 3^x.

Example 1:
In: n = 27
Out: true
Explanation: 27 = 3^3

Example 2:
In: n = 0
Out: false
Explanation: There is no x where 3^x = 0.

Example 3:
In: n = -1
Out: false
Explanation: There is no x where 3x = (-1).
 
Constraints:
-231 <= n <= 231 - 1
Follow up: Could you solve it without loops/recursion?
Think of topics that are most common in classic interview questions for a job in computer science.
output:
1. Data Structures and Algorithms: Commonly asked question is about the various data structures like stacks, queues, linked lists or trees, their time complexities, usage scenarios etc., along with popular algorithms such as sorting methods (QuickSort, Merge Sort), searching techniques (Binary Search) or graph traversal methods (BFS/DFS).

2. Operating Systems Concepts: Understanding concepts related to processes, threads, CPU scheduling, memory management, file systems, interrupt handlers, inter-process communication mechanisms and concurrency control measures.

3. Database Management System: Knowledge on database models like relational model, SQL queries, transactions, indexing schemes, normalization, query optimization strategies, ACID properties etc.

4. Computer Networks: Basic networking concepts including layered architectures, TCP/IP protocols, socket programming, routing, switching, network security features like encryption, firewalls, packet sniffing and denial-of-service attacks.

5. Programming Languages: Questions can be based upon syntaxes, semantics, paradigms and language constructs of commonly used languages such as Java, C++, Python, Ruby or JavaScript.

6. Software Engineering Principles: Topics may include software design patterns, object-oriented analysis/design principles, version-control systems, code reuse methodologies, testing strategies, debugging approaches etc.

7. Web Technologies: Familiarity with HTML/CSS/XML markup languages, HTTP protocol operations, client-server architecture, web application frameworks, RESTful services, AJAX calls, CSS selectors etc.

8. Numerical Computation Techniques: Interviewers might ask you about linear algebraic equations solving, matrix manipulation techniques, numerical integration/differentiation methods, statistical hypothesis tests, probability distribution functions etc.

9. Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning: This area covers knowledge-based systems, expert systems, machine learning algorithms, decision tree induction, genetic algorithms, natural language processing techniques, neural networks, reinforcement learning, supervised vs unsupervised learning approaches etc.

10. Distributed Computing Paradigm: The interviewer could inquire about distributed computing platforms like Hadoop, cloud storage solutions, parallel processing libraries, MapReduce framework, BigData analytics tools, cluster management utilities etc.

instruction:
You are given a programming problem and its implementation. Analyze the problem and implementation and explain the algorithm and approach used to solve the problem. Table: Person
| Column Name | Type     |
| personId          | int         |
| lastName         | varchar |
| firstName         | varchar |
personId is the primary key column for this table.
This table contains information about the ID of some persons and their first and last names.
Table: Address
| Column Name | Type     |
| addressId        | int         |
| personId          | int         |
| city                   | varchar|
| state                | varchar |
addressId is the primary key column for this table.
Each row of this table contains information about the city and state of one person with ID = PersonId.
Write an SQL query to report the first name, last name, city, and state of each person in the Person table. If the address of a personId is not present in the Address table, report null instead.
Return the result table in any order.
Implementation:
select FirstName, LastName, City, State
from Person left join Address
on Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId
;
output:
The given problem involves retrieving data from two tables - 'Person' and 'Address'. The goal is to obtain the Firstname, Lastname, City, and State details of all individuals stored in these tables while handling missing or incomplete records gracefully. 

The solution uses a JOIN operation between both the tables using the common attribute 'PersonID', which serves as the foreign key in the 'Address' Table. A LEFT OUTER JOIN clause has been employed so that every record available in the 'Person' table gets matched against at least one record existing in the 'Address' table irrespective of whether there exists a corresponding entry in it or not. As a consequence, if no matching row could be found in the 'Address' table for a particular individual's id, NULL values get populated automatically in place of those attributes (City & State) unavailable for them.

instruction:
Summarize the article you have been given in a brief manner. Mathematics and art are related in a variety of ways. Mathematics has itself been described as an art motivated by beauty. Mathematics can be discerned in arts such as music, dance, painting, architecture, sculpture, and textiles. This article focuses, however, on mathematics in the visual arts.
Mathematics and art have a long historical relationship. Artists have used mathematics since the 4th century BC when the Greek sculptor Polykleitos wrote his Canon, prescribing proportions conjectured to have been based on the ratio 1:√2 for the ideal male nude. Persistent popular claims have been made for the use of the golden ratio in ancient art and architecture, without reliable evidence. In the Italian Renaissance, Luca Pacioli wrote the influential treatise De divina proportione (1509), illustrated with woodcuts by Leonardo da Vinci, on the use of the golden ratio in art. Another Italian painter, Piero della Francesca, developed Euclid's ideas on perspective in treatises such as De Prospectiva Pingendi, and in his paintings. The engraver Albrecht Dürer made many references to mathematics in his work Melencolia I. In modern times, the graphic artist M. C. Escher made intensive use of tessellation and hyperbolic geometry, with the help of the mathematician H. S. M. Coxeter, while the De Stijl movement led by Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian explicitly embraced geometrical forms. Mathematics has inspired textile arts such as quilting, knitting, cross-stitch, crochet, embroidery, weaving, Turkish and other carpet-making, as well as kilim. In Islamic art, symmetries are evident in forms as varied as Persian girih and Moroccan zellige tilework, Mughal jali pierced stone screens, and widespread muqarnas vaulting.
output: The article discusses how there is a connection between math and various types of art throughout history. Math was first mentioned in art during the time of Polykleitos who created sculptures using ratios that were based off mathematical calculations. During the renaissance, artists like Luca Pacioli wrote about incorporating the Golden Ratio into their works which influenced famous painters such as Pierro de la Francesca. Modern day artists like M.C. Escher also incorporated elements of math into their artwork..........instruction.......................................................................................................................................................................................................

instruction: Improve the article using your knowledge of the topic in order to make it more informative. The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.
output: Fair Trade is an organized social movement that advocates fairer trading conditions between producers and consumers in developed countries and workers and farmers in developing nations. The goal of this movement is to promote sustainable development through equitable relationships among traders, while ensuring that labor, environmental, and social standards are met during the production process - specifically with regards to goods being imported into first world countries from third or second worlds. This initiative aims to address issues such as exploitation, poverty wages, unsafe working environments, child labor, forced labor, gender discrimination, unfair contracts, and unequal bargaining power. By encouraging transparency within supply chains, Fair Trade seeks to empower marginalized communities by providing them access to markets, improving their livelihoods, protecting natural resources, and promoting respect for cultural identities. Through its advocacy efforts, the movement has contributed towards shaping global trade policies and regulations aimed at creating greater economic equality worldwide..instructio

instruction:

It consists of the study, diagnosis, prevention, management, and treatment of diseases, disorders, and conditions of the mouth, most commonly focused on dentition (the development and arrangement of teeth) as well as the oral mucosa. Dentistry may also encompass other aspects of the craniofacial complex including the temporomandibular joint. The practitioner is called a dentist.

La dentisterie peut aussi englober d'autres facettes du complexe crânien-facial incluant le joint temporo-mandibulaire. instruction: Design a syllabus for the given course. Students should be given a list of the chapters with brief explanations of each chapter's purpose. Programming for Everybody (Getting Started with Python)
output:
Course Title: Programming for Everybody (Getting Started With Python)
Instructor: [Your Name]
Duration: Semester Course

Overview:
This is an introductory programming course that will teach you how to write programs using one of the most popular languages, Python. This course covers topics such as variables and data types, conditional statements, loops, functions, lists, dictionaries, file handling, and more. By completing this course, students are expected to gain confidence in their ability to program and apply these concepts to real-world problems.

Prerequisites:
No prior knowledge about computer science or programming is required. However, it would help if you have basic familiarity with computers, including understanding how to start a new application on your device, open files, save them, move back/forward through pages, etc.

Objectives:
By the end of the semester, students must master fundamental coding techniques by learning the following objectives:

- Understand what is a variable and its importance.
- Learn different ways of representing numbers and text strings.
- Use operators like addition (+), subtraction (-), multiplication (*), division (/).
- Write simple mathematical expressions using arithmetic operations and comparison.
- Be able to use decision-making structures like If Else Statements.
- Create well-defined algorithms via looping constructs such as For Loops and While Loops.
- Apply Functions effectively to break down large code into manageable chunks.
- Handle errors gracefully while working with user input.
- Store and retrieve information from files on disk.

Textbook & Material:
There’s no textbook assigned; however, all necessary readings and materials can easily find online resources. 

Grading Policy:
The final grade will be based upon assignments, quizzes, exams, participation, and class attendance. The instructor reserves the right to adjust grading weights at any time during the term. Final grades will be calculated according to the scale below:

| Assignments    | Quizzes       | Exams        |
|----------------|---------------|--------------|
| 25%            | 20%           | 45%          |

Schedule:
Weeks 1 – 4: Introduction to Python
- Week 1: An introduction to Python and its features 
- Week 2: Variables, Data Types, Operators, Expressions, and Strings 
- Week 3: Conditional Structures - If Statement and Comparison Operations  
- Week 4: Looping Constructs - For loop, While loop, Break, Continue  

Weeks 5–8: Basic Input/Output and Lists
- Week 5: Handling User Inputs and Outputting Results 
- Week

instruction: Create a daily itinerary based on the given information. Our family is looking for a 9-day Morocco trip that has light to moderate activity levels.
output:
Day 1: Arrival and sightseeing in Marrakech 
- Arrive at your hotel in Marrakech, check-in, freshen up, have lunch.
- In the afternoon visit Jemaa el-Fnaa square - one of the most famous squares in Africa with its street performers, musicians, dancers, fortune-tellers etc. Also see Koutoubia Mosque and Madrasa Bou Inania before heading back to the hotel.
- Have dinner at local restaurant or enjoy Moroccan cuisine prepared by our hotel chef

Day 2: Excursion into Atlas Mountains 
- After breakfast take an excursion through the beautiful Tachdirt Valley towards the High Atlas mountains where you will meet Berber people who live there. Visit traditional Berber villages, stop at waterfalls, explore mountain scenery, hike around valleys while enjoying panoramic views over the surrounding area.
- Return to Marrakesh late in the evening; relax and rest overnight 

Day 3: Discovering Essaouira 
- Leave early morning from Marrakesh to reach the coastal town of Essaouira (around 4 hours drive). On arrival, stroll along the seaside promenade admiring fisherman boats lined alongside the harbor wall. Explore ancient city walls, medina quarter, souks selling leather goods, spices, carpets, silver jewelry etc.
- Enjoy seafood lunch overlooking Atlantic Ocean then head out to nearby beaches to spend some time relaxing under sun or playing beach volleyball with locals.
- Overnight stay in Essaouira

Day 4: Exploring Chefchaouan 
- Drive southwards passing through Agadir en route to Chefchaouan – picturesque blue-washed Andalucian-style village nestled between two peaks of Middle Atlas Mountain range. Check-in to your riad, freshen-up, grab lunch then go exploring narrow streets, alleys, bustling marketplaces filled with colorful produce, crafts, textiles, pottery, lanterns etc.
- Dinner at a rooftop terrace restaurant offering stunning view of night sky above Medina rooftops

Day 5: A day tour of Fes 
- Head eastward to Fez after having breakfast. Spend entire day visiting oldest university in the world - Al-Qarawiyyin University, medieval tanneries producing finest leathers known worldwide, Souk al-Attarine packed with spice sellers, herbalists, perfumers, copperware shops, goldsmiths etc.
- Take guided walking tours to discover hidden gems tucked away behind winding lanes, alleyways, courtyards. Relax durin

instruction: Give students tips on how to keep their nerves under control during class presentations.
output:
Here are some helpful tips for keeping your nerves in check while delivering a presentation:

1. Practice makes perfect: The more you practice, the more confident and comfortable you'll feel when it's time to present. Take advantage of any opportunities to rehearse beforehand so that you can deliver your speech smoothly without any hiccups or surprises.

2. Know Your Material Inside Out: Knowing your material well will give you confidence because there won't be anything new or unexpected happening as you speak. This way, even if something goes wrong, such as an equipment malfunction, you'll still have all the answers at hand.

3. Keep Calm and Breathe Deeply: When anxiety strikes, take deep breaths and remind yourself that everything is going to be fine. Focus on breathing slowly and steadily, this calms down our nervous system and helps us think clearly.

4. Speak Clearly and Slowly: Don’t rush through your presentation; try speaking slower than usual. It’s important to enunciate each word clearly so everyone can hear what you’re saying.

5. Use Visual Aids: Using visual aids like slideshows, diagrams, charts, etc., can help make your message clearer and easier to understand. These also serve as mental triggers which help reduce stress levels by providing structure to your talk.

6. Maintain Eye Contact with Audience: Maintaining eye contact with audience members shows that you're confident and engaged in the conversation. Make sure to look around the room instead of staring at one person the entire time.

7. Smile Often: Smiling not only puts others at ease but also improves self-confidence. So don't forget to smile often throughout your presentation – it may just brighten up the whole experience!

Remember, being nervous before giving a presentation is completely normal. But following these tips should help minimize those jitters and allow you to focus on delivering a great performance!al design course.al designer salary.al technology.al coaching.al objectives.instructional video.al strategies.al media.al methods.al writing.al systems.al style.al software.al planning.al materials.al management.al learning theory.al leadership.al law.al games.al graphics.al goals.al guide.al ideas.al imagery.al images.al imagination.al innovation.al influences.al inspiration.al intervention.al improvement.a

instruction: You can easily make your holidays more eco-friendly by following these simple steps:
output:
1. Reduce Travel: Instead of taking a flight, consider staying closer to home or traveling by train, bus, bike, or carpooling with friends and family.

2. Use Reusable Bags & Containers: Bring reusable bags when shopping for groceries or holiday gifts, and use glass containers instead of disposable plastic ones.

3. Buy Locally Grown Food: Purchase fresh fruits and vegetables from local farmers markets rather than buying imported produce that has traveled long distances.

4. Choose Sustainable Gifts: When giving presents, opt for items made from sustainable materials such as bamboo, recycled paper, or organic cotton.

5. Conserve Energy: Turn off lights and electronics when not in use, and switch to energy-efficient LED bulbs during the holidays.

6. Recycle Waste Properly: Dispose of waste properly by recycling papers, plastics, metals, and glasses whenever possible.

7. Support Eco-Friendly Companies: Look for companies that have strong environmental policies and practices before making purchases.

By incorporating small changes like these into our daily lives, we can all contribute towards reducing our carbon footprint and preserving our planet's natural resources.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.instructional text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here.al text ends here.al text begins here

instruction: Provide a detailed explanation of the steps that are required in order to construct the given project. Steam Engine Using an Empty Beer Can
output:
To build a steam engine using an empty beer can, you will need to follow these step-by-step instructions:

1. Gather materials: To make this model steam engine work, gather some basic supplies such as:
    - An empty aluminum or steel soda/beer can 
    - A small metal bolt and nut (about half inch)
    - Rubber bands
    - Scissors for cutting paper
2. Prepare your beer/soda can: Clean out any remaining residue from inside the can by rinsing it with water.
3. Cut off top portion of the can: Use scissors or sharp knife to carefully cut away about one-third section on the upper end of the can's side walls leaving intact its bottom and lid portions. This is where the piston rod will move up and down when activated.
4. Make valve assembly: Take two pieces of rubber band measuring around six inches long each; tie them together at their ends so they form a loop shape. Slide the loose ends through the opening made earlier at the top part of the can until they come into contact with the interior wall near the base of the open area. Securely attach the other end of both rubber bands onto the outside of the can’s lower rim.
5. Assemble connecting rod: From the middle of the opened-up can, slide-in place a small metal bolt which serves as the crankshaft. The head of the bolt should be located just below the level of the newly formed cylinder while its threaded shaft must extend upwards beyond the can’s mouth.
6. Attach flywheel: Fold a piece of cardboard into a circle big enough to cover entirely the upper end of the can’s mouth. Staple securely the edges of the cardboard disc over the can’s lip making sure there aren’t any gaps left between the folded cardstock material and the sides of the container.
7. Add fuel source: Place either cotton balls soaked with rubbing alcohol or tissue papers saturated with white glue close to the bottom of the can’s internal space right beside the valve mechanism.
8. Test run: Lighten up the wick/fuel source then hold the free ends of the rubber bands taut before releasing them gently. You’ll see how the piston moves up and down within the confines of the cylindrical chamber driven by the reciprocating motion created by the expanding air trapped in the valve assembly.
9. Optional improvements: If desired, add additional decorative features like wheels or axles attached to the crankshaft's rotating movement or paint the exterior surface of the finished product according to personal preference.

instruction: Answer the following literature question as accurately as possible based on your knowledge of literature for high school students. What does the green light symbolize at the end of the book?
output: The "green light" in F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel, The Great Gatsby, is a recurring image that represents Jay Gatsby's hopes and dreams; his aspiration to attain wealth and win back Daisy Buchanan, who he had fallen deeply in love with while serving overseas during World War I. It also serves as an embodiment of the American Dream- the idea that one can achieve success through hard work and determination. At the end of the novel, when Gatsby reaches out towards the green light from across the bay representing the future, it signifies his ultimate ambition and desire which ultimately leads him to his tragic demise..instructio

instruction: Develop a mental exercise that can help people manage their anxiety and explain how it works.
output:
One effective technique to reduce anxiety is called "cognitive restructuring." This involves changing negative or anxious thoughts into more positive, reassuring ones. Here's an example of how this could work:

1. Identify your trigger: Start by identifying the thought, situation or event that triggers your anxiety.
2. Challenge Negative Thoughts: Once you've identified what causes your anxiety, challenge those thoughts with evidence-based logic. For instance, if you're feeling overwhelmed about having too much on your plate at home or work, remind yourself that you have successfully handled similar situations before and will be able to do so again in the present moment.
3. Reframe Your Thought: Next, reframe your anxious thought using facts and reasoning. Instead of thinking “I’m going to fail,” tell yourself “I’ve prepared well for this task.”
4. Take Action: Finally, take action based on your new perspective. Don't avoid the source of your anxiety; instead face them head-on knowing that you are capable of handling whatever comes your way.

This simple yet powerful practice helps shift our mindset from one of fear and uncertainty to confidence and calmness. By challenging our anxious thoughts and reframing them in a more realistic light, we gain control over our emotions and ultimately feel less stressed and more equipped to handle any challenges ahead..instructio

instruction: In relation to the given weather scenario, give some tips on how to adjust the travel plans with it. a sudden temperature change
output:
If you are planning a trip and there is an unexpected drop in temperatures or any other adverse weather conditions such as heavy rain, snowstorms or high winds, here are some suggestions for adjusting your travel plan:

1. Monitor local forecasts: Keep track of changing weather patterns and make sure that you have accurate information about what kind of weather to expect during your journey.
2. Allow extra time for delays: If bad weather is forecasted, be prepared for possible flight cancellations, road closures, traffic jams or train delays. Try to build additional buffer times into your schedule so that unforeseen circumstances do not derail all your efforts.
3. Pack accordingly: Make sure you bring along warm clothing if it's going to get colder than expected; waterproof gear like jackets, hats, gloves etc., if rainfall is predicted. Bring enough food, water and medication to last longer than usual just in case something goes wrong.
4. Stay safe: Avoid traveling through areas where natural disasters may strike or roads might become impassable due to floods or landslides. Be cautious while driving especially when icy roads or strong gusts of wind are present.
5. Have backup options ready: Always have alternative routes planned out in advance, know which hotels/motels offer shelter from inclement weather, keep emergency numbers handy including those for roadside assistance, towing services, car rentals and taxi companies.
6. Consider postponing your travels: In extreme cases, consider rescheduling your trip until better weather arrives. This will help ensure your safety and comfort throughout the entire duration of your journey.al texts only.instructional texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only.al texts only

instruction: Plan an agenda for the daily standup meetings. Assign a time duration to each topic on the agenda.
output:
Here is one suggested agenda format that could be used in your daily stand-up meeting:

1. Opening (2 minutes): Start by welcoming everyone and setting expectations about how long this meeting will last, what topics are going to be discussed, etc.
 
2. Review of Yesterday's Progress (3-5 minutes): Each team member should briefly share their accomplishments from yesterday. This gives visibility into progress made towards project goals or sprint targets.
  
3. Discussion of Today’s Plan (8-10 minutes): Team members should discuss any obstacles they may have encountered while working on tasks assigned to them earlier. They can also mention if there were any changes required due to unforeseen circumstances. 

4. Prioritization & Reassignment of Tasks (3-5 minutes): During this section, you’ll review all outstanding issues and decide who needs to take care of which task today. If anyone has been pulled off another task mid-sprint, it might make sense to reassign some work accordingly.

5. Wrap Up (2 Minutes) : Finally, wrap up the discussion with an overview of next steps, decisions taken during the meeting and anything else relevant to follow up before concluding the session.al text here

This agenda ensures that every day starts with clear communication among team members regarding current projects' status, responsibilities, priorities and overall progress. instruction: Give a grammar tip on how to end a German verb.
output:
To correctly form the past tense of a German verb, you need to follow these steps:

1. Remove the infinitive ending (-en) from the base verb.
2. Replace it with one of two endings:
   - If the verb is first or third conjugation (ends in -t), add '-te' for masculine and neuter nouns, and '–test' for feminine noun.
   - For second-conjugation verbs that ends in consonant or vowel other than "e", remove the final "-n" and replace it with '-ten'.
3. Add an appropriate subject pronoun suffix if necessary. 

For example: 
- sprechen -> sprach
- lieben -> liebte / geliebt
- gehen -> gingal.al.al.al.alinstructio

instruction: Describe how to prepare the given food in your own words. Note down the ingredients you will need and the steps you will take to prepare them. Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies
output:
Making chewy chocolate chip cookies is a simple process that requires just a few basic ingredients, along with some mixing and baking time. Here's what you'll need:

Ingredients:
- All-purpose flour (1 cup)
- Baking soda (½ teaspoon)
- Salt (¼ teaspoon)
- Unsalted butter (softened at room temperature - ¾ cup)
- White sugar (1 cup)
- Brown sugar (½ cup)
- Vanilla extract (1 tablespoon)
- Eggs (2 large)
- Semi-sweet chocolate chips (12 ounces)

Instructions:

1) Start by preheating your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
 
2) In one bowl, mix together all of the dry ingredients: Flour, baking soda, and salt.
  
3) In another larger bowl, cream softened butter and both sugars until they are smooth and well combined. You can use an electric mixer for this step if desired.
   
4) Add vanilla extract into wet mixture then stir it in completely before adding eggs. Mix these two together until creamy and fluffy. 

5) Gradually incorporate the dry ingredient mixture into the wet mixture while stirring constantly.
 
6) Fold in semi-sweet chocolate chips using spatula or spoon.

7) Once everything has been mixed thoroughly, drop rounded tablespoons onto parchment paper-lined cookie sheets.

8) Bake the cookies for about 10 minutes on middle rack, keeping an eye out so they don't burn.

9) When done, remove from oven, let cool slightly before transferring to wire racks. Allow cookies to fully cool before serving.

Enjoy!...instruction..............................................................................................

instruction: Suggest a recipe for a vegan dessert.
output:
One delicious and easy-to-make vegan dessert is chocolate mousse. Here's what you'll need:

Ingredients:
- 1 cup of raw cashews, soaked in water overnight or boiled for about half an hour
- 2 tablespoons of cocoa powder 
- 3 tablespoons of maple syrup (or any other sweetener)
- Juice from one lemon
- Pinch of salt

Instructions: 

1. Drain the cashews well after soaking them.
2. Add all ingredients into your blender, starting with the cashews first then adding remaining ingredients on top.
3. Blend until smooth and creamy.
4. Pour mixture into serving bowls or glasses.
5. Refrigerate for at least two hours before serving to allow it set up.
6. Top each bowl with fresh fruits like strawberries, raspberries or blueberries, if desired.

Enjoy this rich, decadent yet healthy treat

instruction: Design a medium-level sudoku puzzle.
output:
Here is one way to design a medium level Sudoku puzzle:

1. Start with an empty grid of size 9 x 9.
2. Divide the grid into nine 3x3 sub-grids (also known as blocks or boxes).
3. Fill in the first row, column and box such that each cell contains a number from 1-9 without any duplicates within these rows/columns/boxes respectively.
4. Then fill up remaining cells by placing numbers randomly keeping in mind the following constraints:
    - Each row should contain all digits from 1 to 9 only once 
    - Each column should also have all digits from 1 to 9 appearing just once
    - The same digit cannot be repeated in any given block

5. To make it slightly harder, add some clues which are already filled in certain positions according to your desired difficulty.

The final solved grid would look like this: 

```
| 6 | 8 |. |
| 7 | 3 | 5 |
| 4 | 9 | 1 |

| 3 |. | 7 |
|. | 6 | 2 |
| 5 |. |.|

| 1 | 2 |.|
|. |. |.|
|. |. |.|

instruction: Prove the given statement using your information. "If x is a positive integer or a solution to x+3>4, then x>0 and x>12."
output:
The statement can be proved by algebraic manipulation of inequalities. 

If we assume that "x" satisfies either one of two conditions: 
1) it's a positive integer; OR 
2) its value makes the inequality true (i.e., greater than), where x + 3 > 4

We want to show that this implies another condition, which is: "x > 0 AND x > 12".

Let us begin with Case #1 first.
Assuming x is a positive integer means x >= 1 because all integers are whole numbers including negative ones.

Now let’s move on to Case #2:
Since we know that x + 3 > 4, subtracting '3' from both sides gives x > 1.

Therefore, in both cases, we have shown that x must be larger than zero i.e. x > 0.

Next, since x > 0, adding 12 to both sides yields x + 12 > 12. But, according to our assumption, x + 3 already exceeds 4. Therefore, we also get x + 12 > 4.

In conclusion, for any real number ‘x’ satisfying the stated conditions, we showed that “x > 0” as well as “x > 12”..instructio

instruction:

Fact: The square of any real number is non-negative.
output:
We can start by substituting k with a variable n. Thus, we get:

k = n

So our original inequality becomes:
n^2+2n+1 >= 0 

Since this expression represents a quadratic function and its discriminant (b^2 -4ac) equals to zero or less than it, then it's positive for all values of 'n'. Therefore, our final proof would be as follows:

Given an integer k,

Letting k=n,
we obtain n^2+2n+1>=0.
Since the value inside the parenthesis is always greater than or equal to zero, 
hence proved..instructio

The product of any number with an odd number will always be odd because when multiplying by an even number (which can be represented as a multiple of 2) it adds or subtracts an even from another odd resulting in an overall odd value. Hence, for every integer pair where both values are odd, their multiplication would result in an odd answer. manual. instruction:
Give a brief explanation of the requested part of the paper. Paper: The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks that include an encoder and a decoder. The best performing models also connect the encoder and decoder through an attention mechanism. We propose a new simple network architecture, the Transformer, based solely on attention mechanisms, dispensing with recurrence and convolutions entirely. Experiments on two machine translation tasks show these models to be superior in quality while being more parallelizable and requiring significantly less time to train. Our model achieves 28.4 BLEU on the WMT 2014 English-to-German translation task, improving over the existing best results, including ensembles, by over 2 BLEU. On the WMT 2014 English-to-French translation task, our model establishes a new single-model state-of-the-art BLEU score of 41.8 after training for 3.5 days on eight GPUs, a small fraction of the training costs of the best models from the literature. We show that the Transformer generalizes well to other tasks by applying it successfully to English constituency parsing both with large and limited training data.
Explain: The dominant sequence transduction models
output: The section you have referred to is about the introduction of "Transformer" - which is a novel approach to natural language processing (NLP) using only attention-based mechanisms instead of relying on traditional Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs). This method was introduced as a replacement for previous NLP techniques such as RNNs because they were found to be faster and easier to use than their predecessors.. It explains how this particular model has become increasingly popular among researchers due to its performance advantage compared to previously used methods like RNNs. Additionally, experiments conducted showed significant improvements when utilizing Transformers, resulting in higher accuracy rates during translations between languages.. Overall, the passage highlights the importance and significance of the Transformer's development within the field of NLP.instruction

instruction: Recommend some helpful activities or conversation starters to use at meetups to break the ice.
output:
1. Icebreaker games: Organize a fun game like two truths and lie, never have I ever, trust fall or scavenger hunt that will get everyone interacting with each other in an enjoyable way.

2. Group challenges: Set up team-building tasks such as group drawing, solving puzzles or making human pyramids which require collaboration among members.

3. Creative workshops: Plan art classes, cooking sessions or craft tutorials where attendees can learn new skills together while having fun.

4. Theme nights: Host themed events around holidays or popular interests of your community. For instance, you could organize costume parties, movie screenings or trivia night based on favorite TV shows.

5. Community projects: Assign small groups of people tasks related to local volunteering opportunities. This is great for bonding over shared goals and giving back to the community.

6. Interactive discussions: Encourage open conversations by asking thought-provoking questions about personal experiences, beliefs or opinions. 

7. Outdoor adventures: Take advantage of good weather by going hiking, camping or kayaking. instruction: Extract the method that has been used in the research from the abstract of the paper. Give the exact sentences from the abstract that discuss the method. We present a state-of-the-art speech recognition system developed using end-to-end deep learning. Our architecture is significantly simpler than traditional speech systems, which rely on laboriously engineered processing pipelines; these traditional systems also tend to perform poorly when used in noisy environments. In contrast, our system does not need hand-designed components to model background noise, reverberation, or speaker variation, but instead directly learns a function that is robust to such effects. We do not need a phoneme dictionary, nor even the concept of a "phoneme." Key to our approach is a well-optimized RNN training system that uses multiple GPUs, as well as a set of novel data synthesis techniques that allow us to efficiently obtain a large amount of varied data for training. Our system, called Deep Speech, outperforms previously published results on the widely studied Switchboard Hub5'00, achieving 16.0% error on the full test set. Deep Speech also handles challenging noisy environments better than widely used, state-of-the-art commercial speech systems.Collapse
```
output: The presented study utilized an 'end-to-end deep learning' methodology in developing their speech recognition system, resulting in a simplified architecture compared to conventional methods requiring labored-engineered processing pipelines. The model did not require hand-designed elements to account for environmental factors like background noises and speaker variations, with its performance being learned through direct exposure to such influences. Additionally, this technique doesn't necessitate a predefined phonetic dictionary or understanding of phonemes. A crucial component was the optimization of an RNN (Recurrent Neural Network) training mechanism utilizing multiple GPUs alongside innovative data generation strategies allowing efficient acquisition of diverse information. This resulted in the development of Deep Speech, surpassing previous publications on the commonly examined Switchboard Hub5'00 dataset by producing only 16% errors while performing more effectively under demanding noisy conditions relative to contemporary industrial-grade speech models.al.al.al.instructional.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.al.a

instruction: Create a short, concise summary of the paper based on its abstract. Few-shot learning (FSL) is one of the key future steps in machine learning and raises a lot of attention. In this paper, we focus on the FSL problem of dialogue understanding, which contains two closely related tasks: intent detection and slot filling. Dialogue understanding has been proven to benefit a lot from jointly learning the two sub-tasks. However, such joint learning becomes challenging in the few-shot scenarios: on the one hand, the sparsity of samples greatly magnifies the difficulty of modeling the connection between the two tasks; on the other hand, how to jointly learn multiple tasks in the few-shot setting is still less investigated. In response to this, we introduce FewJoint, the first FSL benchmark for joint dialogue understanding. FewJoint provides a new corpus with 59 different dialogue domains from real industrial API and a code platform to ease FSL experiment set-up, which are expected to advance the research of this field. Further, we find that insufficient performance of the few-shot setting often leads to noisy sharing between two sub-task and disturbs joint learning. To tackle this, we guide slot with explicit intent information and propose a novel trust gating mechanism that blocks low-confidence intent information to ensure high quality sharing. Besides, we introduce a Reptile-based meta-learning strategy to achieve better generalization in unseen few-shot domains. In the experiments, the proposed method brings significant improvements on two datasets and achieve new state-of-the-art performance.
output: The paper focuses on applying few shot learning techniques to improve dialogue understanding by combining intent detection and slot filling tasks. It introduces a new dataset called "FewJoint" designed specifically for few shot learning in dialogue understanding, and proposes an approach using a trust-gating mechanism and reptile-based meta-learning technique to increase accuracy while reducing noise caused by limited data available in few shot settings. The results show improved performance over previous methods achieving state-of-the-art outcomes.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.instructional design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.al design.a

1. Linear Algebra: This includes matrices and vector operations.

instruction:
Given a programming language and the name of a function, write a command to show how to use the function. Language: Python
Function: input
output:
In order to use the `input` function in Python, you can follow these steps:

1. Start by writing or importing your code into an editor.
2. Define where you want to call this function within your program's flow. For example:
```python 
my_input = input("Please enter something:")
```
3. Within that section of code, type out the function with parentheses following it as well as any arguments you would like to pass inside those parentheses. In our case we are using no parameters so the line will look like above.
4. Run the file either through terminal/command prompt or directly from the IDE/editor you're working on.
5. Execute the code up until the point where the user is prompted for their input. The text provided after the colon (`:`) will be shown before waiting for them to respond.
6. Once they provide some response, store that value in whatever variable you have defined (in our case `my_input`) and continue execution of the rest of your program..instructio
